faqs.question: Why does the Update Checker show incorrect version information?
faqs.answer:
### Common Update Checker Issues

**Using Outdated Plugin:**
- Blender 4.2: Should report version 4.2.x.x
- Older versions reporting 0.50.0 or 3.6.4 need updating

**Version Number Format:**
- Current format: 4.2.x.x (e.g., 4.2.1.0)
- Old format: 0.50.0, 3.6.4 (without final digit)

**VPN Issues:**
- Some VPN providers may interfere with the version checker

[warning]If using versions before 3.6.4.1 or 4.2.2.1, update your plugin first. Issues reported for outdated versions will be closed unless verified as legitimate updater problems.[/warning]

[note]If the updater suggests a version for a different Blender version, you likely have an old plugin version. Please manually update to the correct version for your Blender installation.[/note]

faqs.question: Why can't I see Pose Mode?
faqs.answer:
### Pose Mode Requirements

- You must have a model imported first
- The model needs a valid armature

Pose Mode will only appear when these conditions are met, as it's specifically for posing armatures.

faqs.question: Why doesn't the addon show up or gives errors after installation?
faqs.answer:
### Installation Requirements

**Verify Version Compatibility:**
- Use our [link]https://catsblenderplugin.xyz/|Version Selector[/link] to download the correct CATS version for your Blender
- Each Blender version requires its specific CATS version

**Required Steps:**
- Restart Blender after installing CATS
- This step is essential for all features to work correctly

faqs.question: What are these policy violation warnings in Blender 4.2+?
faqs.answer:
These warnings are expected and can be safely ignored:

### Technical Background
- Blender 4.2+ introduced new Extension system standards
- CATS was developed before these standards existed
- CATS uses legacy methods for loading 3rd party addons (like MMD Tools)

[note]These warnings don't affect any CATS functionality - everything works as intended.[/note]

[image]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/catsblenderplugin/website/wiki/Screenshot_from_2024-07-12_20-19-25.png[/image]

### Why This Happens
Blender 4.2+ has implemented stricter standards for addon development. While CATS remains fully functional, its method of loading third-party addons triggers these new policy warnings.
